title: [$250] Expense - Splitting a Per Diem Expense with Large Amount Causes Unexpected Error

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.2.46-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1856/folder/13176670/45748766/999689654 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** Slottwo1 72old.approver@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Redminote 10s android 13 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/home 2. Open workpace settings 3. Enable per diem feature and import per diem rates 4. Create a per diem expense Algeria - overnight - 999999999999 5. Complete the flow 6. Note user can create per diem expense with big amount without error 7. Tap more - Split expense 8. Tap save ## Expected Result: If the system allows creation of a Per Diem expense with a large amount, it should also allow splitting that expense without any error. ## Actual Result: *User is able to create a Per Diem expense with a very large amount (e.g., 999999999999) without any error. *However, when attempting to split the same expense and tapping Save, an unexpected error occurs. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6e6ef2ec-c0a8-4dfc-a8fb-78d762bc8bce [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!

**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1762375037765209

## Action Performed:
Break down in numbered steps

1. Open the chat switcher
2. type a name of someone you know and have a chat with

## Expected Result:
Describe what you think should've happened

The focus should autofocus on the first result so that you dont need to click arrow down and you need to enter

## Actual Result:
Describe what actually happened

This is flaky, it seems to focus on the first result sometimes but not always - probably some race condition

## Workaround:
Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround?

title: [$250] Add guard in OnyxUtils to skip subscriptions for invalid keys

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Background Some code paths attempt to subscribe to collection members whose IDs are invalid (e.g., report_undefined, ..._null, ..._NaN). Even with skippableCollectionMemberIDs configured, these invalid keys still create a subscription and emit an initial callback, adding overhead and noise. ### Problem Subscriptions are created for invalid keys like report_undefined, which still emit an initial callback and add overhead. ### Solution Add a guard in OnyxUtils.subscribeToKey that checks skippableCollectionMemberIDs and, if the collection member ID is skippable (e.g., 'undefined', 'null', 'NaN'), do not connect the subscription or emit the initial value, but return a subscriptionID so disconnect() is safe. #### Results Reduces fireCallbacks invocations by ~12% skipping all the invalid collection IDs ### Next steps Do testing and comparison of the effect of this change in real account

title: [$250] The Distance Rate section is displayed after duplicating a workspace.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.45-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @linhvovan29546 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1762422268716889) ## Action Performed: 1. Open the Workspace List page 2. Turn off the internet 3. Duplicate a workspace (without enabling Distance Rate) 4. Confirm the duplication 5. Open the duplicated workspace 6. Turn the internet connection back on ## Expected Result: Possibly the Distance Rate section should not be displayed in select features to copy ## Actual Result: Distance rate section checked and displayed in select features to copy, the Distance Rate section is displayed in workspace and, after turning the internet back on, the Distance Rate section becomes hidden. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
